info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 1:10PM EDT until May 31 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...
Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern affecting Lebanon and Schuylkill Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern.
* WHEN...Until this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Several driveways and other minor roadways are affected. Water begins to enter some basements. At 10.0 feet, High water isolates several houses.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:36 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:36 PM EDT Saturday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest just under 10 feet and then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 05/08/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING
